moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8
comment: Protects the Bishop in b7 and prepares the possible push c7-c5.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6
comment: Both the players keep a prudent attitude.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O
comment:
Again too 
mach prudent. Better would have been 8. d5 and after 8... Ne7 9. e4 exd5 10.
cxd5 d6 11. O-O Ng6 12. Re1 White would have had some advantage in space and
developement.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6
comment:
If Black would
have not resisted from winning a Pawn with 11... dxc3 12. Bxc3 Qxc4 13. Ne5
Qc7 14. Bxb7 Qxb7 15. Nc4 he would have been in severe delay in developement
and would have given very good chances to the opponent.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8
comment: The best, maybe. The exchange 12...Bxe4 would have been favourable to White.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4
comment:
Uncertain. Probably 16.. .0-0
was better. With the Pawn sacrifice Black tries to exploit the opening of the
g-file.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4
comment: Lilienthal aceppts the challenge and ... takes the Pawn.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8
comment:
And for the second time Black puts a light piece on its
home square. This time, by the way, the retreat is justified. By protecting
the d6 square it opens the file to the Rook.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8
comment:
The game is getting
complicated. Of course now it is not convenient to play 20. Qxh5 because of di
20...Bxe4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5
comment:
Combines its action with the Bishop and,
by protecting the h5 Knight it threats 22...Rxg2 followed by 23.Qxe4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5 22. Qxh5 Qxh5 23. Nf6+ Kd8
comment:
And now? What to do next? If White takes the Queen after 24.
Nxh5 it would follow 24...Bxg2+ with all its unclear consequences. If 23...
Ke7 White declines the Queen and after 24. Nxg8+ Kd8 25. Bxb7 it is in very
good shape.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5 22. Qxh5 Qxh5 23. Nf6+ Kd8 24. Nxe6+

1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5 22. Qxh5 Qxh5 23. Nf6+ Kd8 24. Nxe6+ Ke7
comment: The Knight could not be taken: 24... fxe6 25. Rxd7+ Kc8 26.Bxb7+ Kb8 27. Nxh5

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5 22. Qxh5 Qxh5 23. Nf6+ Kd8 24. Nxe6+ Ke7 25. Nxg8+
comment:
When a player prefers to take a Rook instead of a Queen, there are
two possibilites: he is totally confused, or he has seen the way to the
victory.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5 22. Qxh5 Qxh5 23. Nf6+ Kd8 24. Nxe6+ Ke7 25. Nxg8+ Kxe6 26. Bxb7 Rd8 27. Bd5+ Kf5
comment:
The endgame rulting from 27...
Qxd5 28. Rxd5 Kxd5 29. Nf6+ followed by 30...Nxh7 would be hopeless for Black.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5 22. Qxh5 Qxh5 23. Nf6+ Kd8 24. Nxe6+ Ke7 25. Nxg8+ Kxe6 26. Bxb7 Rd8 27. Bd5+ Kf5 28. Bf3 Qh3+
comment:
If 28... Qg6 then 29. Rd5+ Kxf4 30. Rc1 b5 (31. Rc4+ was
threatened) 31. Rcd1 f5 32. R1d4+ Kg5 33. h4#

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 b6 3. g3 Bb7 4. Nf3 Qc8 5. Bg2 e6 6. Nc3 Nc6 7. a3 a6 8. O-O Ne7 9. Qc2 c5 10. Bg5 cxd4 11. Bxf6 gxf6 12. Ne4 Ng8 13. Nxd4 f5 14. Nd2 Bg7 15. Qd3 Nf6 16. Rfe1 f4 17. gxf4 Nh5 18. Ne4 Bf8 19. Qf3 Rg8 20. Kf1 Qxc4 21. Red1 Qd5 22. Qxh5 Qxh5 23. Nf6+ Kd8 24. Nxe6+ Ke7 25. Nxg8+ Kxe6 26. Bxb7 Rd8 27. Bd5+ Kf5 28. Bf3 Qh3+ 29. Bg2 Qxh2 30. Rd5+ Ke6
comment:
After 30... Kxf4 White mates after few moves. If 30... Kg4 mate in two. So
what is the point in going further? Mate in one and it'sover!
